item.title: rnoaa - Weather data in R
item.description: NOAA provides a lot of weather data, across many different websites under different project names. The R package rnoaa accesses many of these, including: NOAA NCDC climate data, using the NCDC API version 2 GHCND FTP data ISD FTP data Severe weather data docs are at https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/swdiws/ Sea ice data NOAA buoy data Tornadoes! Data from the NOAA Storm Prediction Center HOMR - Historical Observing Metadata Repository - from NOAA NCDC Storm data - from the International Best Track Archive for Climate Stewardship (IBTrACS) rnoaa used to provide access to ERDDAP servers, but a separate package rerddap focuses on just those data sources.

item.title: rerddap - General purpose R client for ERDDAP servers
item.description: ERDDAP is a data server that gives you a simple, consistent way to download subsets of gridded and tabular scientific datasets in common file formats and make graphs and maps. Besides itâ€™s own RESTful interface, much of which is designed based on OPeNDAP, ERDDAP can act as an OPeNDAP server and as a WMS server for gridded data. ERDDAP is a powerful tool - in a world of heterogeneous data, it’s often hard to combine data and serve it through the same interface, with tools for querying/filtering/subsetting the data.
